Message.Title: The democrat majority Senate rejects border fence
Message.Msg: Senators on Tuesday rejected building the 700 miles of double-tier border fencing Congress authorized just seven years ago, with a majority of the Senate saying they didn’t want to delay granting illegal immigrants legal status while the fence was being built. The 54-39 vote to reject the fence shows the core of the immigration deal is holding. The vote broke mostly along party lines with the Democrat majority voting against building the border fence. Republicans had offered the fence as a way to build the confidence of voters skeptical that the government will enforce its laws, but democrats said building more fencing is costly, would take too long, and shouldn’t be dictated by Washington. Where's the outcry from yahoo "news" and the rest of the least-watched leftists in the mainstream media?

Topic.Title: The NSA admits listening to U.S. phone calls without warrants

Message.Msg: Conversations are being monitored and recorded from reporters in the media who were critical of Obama and conservative groups. (By the way, we learned last month from confessions that the IRS was targetting Tea Party) We learned that government snoops of facebook and social sites to target criticism of Obama to find who to target. Data is recorded at the new multi-billion dollar data collection center in Utah. Petting, you are far behind current events in the news and I advise that you need to read up on the r4 ecent Obama scandals that were uncovered.

Message.Title: A new Spark is Comming
Message.Msg: According to WIRE MAG, Yahoo is testing a new software platform called SPARK, and according to those who built it and use it, it’s about 100 times faster than the current platform Hadoop. According to Yahoo’s Ram Sriharsha, the platform will provide a quicker means of determining which ads it should show to which visitors. “We’re in the process of putting it into production,” he says. “It will inform our data centers on how to get the best return on investment for our advertisers.” Soon Yahoo will be on equal footing to GOOGLE and leave behind the others!

Topic.Title: A new Spark is Comming

Message.Msg: Hadoop does a pretty terrible job with machine learning,” Xin says. “Spark is good with logistic regression, and that can help with anything that involves a binary decision: Is this message spam? Should I show this ad to this user?” Then, of course, the company can use the platform to rapidly analyze the vast amounts of data generated by services across the Yahoo empire.
